name: Baghvan Taj Wilderness Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went for a 4 day stay and it was just about perfect.
reviews.title: Such personnal service, all the time.

reviews.text: The staff amazed from the minute we arrived until we finally left. 4 evening meals and all eaten in different locations in different fashion thanks to the effort the staff put in. A perfect romantic treat, without any effort.
reviews.title: wonderful experience at baghvan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sitting down with your allocated butler and chef and walking through the type of cuisine and any dietary restrictions was a blessing and made for a very personalised menu. The effort was truly remarkable to make sure you received a very impressive feast each day.
reviews.title: Heaven in the jungle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location so close to Pench park is perfect and even thou its a 4:30am wake up call the days went smoothly with all comforts expected.
reviews.title: THE place to stay while at Pench, if you can afford it!

reviews.text: Thanks for a brilliant safari trip, well recommended to all.
reviews.title: Eclectic decor, elegant
Romantic, Relaxing, and Wild
reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about Baghvan. First, the pictures don't do it justice. The main spaces are just beautiful and decorated with antiques from all over India (lanterns from Rajastan; tables from Kerala; etc.) and the suite of rooms everyone gets are spectacular. Second, the food is absolutely delicious. Each meal has something surprising about it, and no meal is the same. I came to the lodge a bit sick, and the chef was able to customize food for me. Third, the service is incredible. Everyone knows your name, quickly learns your morning tea preferences, your evening cocktail preferences, etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finally, the wildlife is awesome. Our various guides (Deepu and Vrushal (whose name I might be mis-spelling)) were knowledgable, talkative, and enthusiastic. We saw all sorts of things we never expected to see, including jackals, leopards, spotted deer, sambhur deer, nilgai, eagles, owls, vultures, storks, cranes, lizards, a civet, a mongoose, and of course a tiger (from elephant back)!
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience

likes.disliked: — Food.. a little too bland.. Probably watered down for western palate

reviews.text: I can't wait to go back. This vacation offered us a much needed romantic respite from our otherwise hectic (though wonderful) trip to India.
reviews.title: A very special place

likes.liked: — care and passion of the staff, mixture of luxury and proximity to nature

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool is amazing too (you see kingfishers and rollers, and a tribe of monkeys hanging out while you hang out).
reviews.title: Heaven on earth !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I and my wife stayed at Taj Bagh Van for 2 N 3 days in April 2008. The lodge is situated very close to the park gate, located in the buffer zone of the forest... We saw a Sambar deer right outside our room and apparently it was a regular visitor to the pool..
reviews.title: Excellent Luxury Safari Option

likes.disliked: — Food.. a little too bland.. Probably watered down for western palate

reviews.title: cool
reviews.text: A cool place to hang out after the wild safari. Good combination of traditional and international cuisine is an add on.

We stayed at Baghvan in January for 2 nights over the republic day weekend.... The lodge is located in close proximity to the park gate and overlooks a nallah (dry river)..The staff at the lodge are great.. .our naturalist Dipu was was very skilled and we saw 2 tigers besides a host of other animals.. the rooms could have been better appointed and are not as plush as Banjaar Tola (the Taj Safaris property at Kanha) The machan was our favorite place to hang out during the afternoons and is a great idea... A special shout out to chef Shinde who prepared some of the better meals i've had in my life... a great wildlife experience overall!!
reviews.title: Excellent property.. great food.. g

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at Baghvan on 29th December 2009 at around 2:00 PM, and stayed for 3 nights, bringing in the new year. We were 3 couples, each with one child, making it a total of 9. It was a memorable experience and one that I would highly recommend. What follows is an account of what we loved, and what we felt could be better, intended both for researchers who may be considering visiting, as well as for Taj/Baghvan management, should they be interested in the feedback.
reviews.title: Well done Taj Safaris – but could’ve been still better – with a few small improvements

reviews.text: Things we loved
reviews.title: Must See place before u die !!

reviews.text: 1. The Rooms
reviews.title: WOW!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I came here for a two night stay after visiting Kanha National Park. We stayed at the sister property, Banjaar Tola. We arrived around noon and was served a delicious lunch to prep us for our afternoon drive. The staff and management were warm and welcoming. The lodge is beautifully appointed and luxurious. There is even wi-fi in the lounge area for those who want to stay connected to the world.
reviews.title: The place to stay when visiting Pench National Park

reviews.text: We didn't want to miss any drives since we were there for such a short time. We left the lodge at 2:45pm and were first on line to enter the park. The park is absolutely beautiful with teak trees and it is less dense in comparison to Kanha. There are rolling hills (small ones) and lots of watering holes. The jungle here is absolutely scenic. It is warmer than Kanha so the drives are very pleasant. There is a route-system which your vehicle is assigned to so your naturalist has to stay on that route (which can make it difficult if a tiger is by a different route) but in all of this - there is a huge element of chance. We shared a vehicle with another family which saw tigers in the morning. One while driving and another w/cub(s) on elephant back. We unfortunately didn't see any tigers during our stay. We heard all of the alarm calls but missed out on the beautiful tiger. Nevertheless, we were not disheartened. The wilderness and nature itself sufficiently awed us. We saw a mongoose, plenty of birds, deers and scenic backwaters. The drives here are shorter than the ones in Kanha (since you're assigned to a route, there's just so many times, you can drive back and forth) which makes it easier on you. You depart at 5:45am after being served coffee/tea or juice (there are cookies if you need something more substantial). You get back to the resort an hour to two before noon and are served a scrumptious breakfast. You can order whatever you like. After the evening drive, you can go to the kitchen for an interactive cooking experience. I watched the first night while the chef demonstrated how to use some basic indian spices. You get to taste of course! Dinner was always very delicious. There was such a huge selection served! On our last evening, the staff arranged a surprise for us, under the guise that we were going to see a flying squirrel, only to lead us to a private dinner in the jungle. It was absolutely romantic and above the call of duty to make our stay special. Need I convince you that you should visit as well?
reviews.title: An out of the world experience !

reviews.text: Baghvan at Pench is an experience one can happily relive a zillion times and still long for more !. The property is absolutely top drawer but that is only to be expected. The fact that the property blends so effortlessly with the jungle around without scrimping on luxury richly adds to the experience. But what really makes the place unforgettable is the team that mans the property. They are the real heart and soul of the experience. They charmed us off our pants and how !. They are an unbelievably and unfailingly brilliant bunch. Kudos to Rafique, Wasim, Brian, Sachin, KT, Sajith, Yusuf and their teams . Their ability to engage with guests to enhance the experience of the place, wilderness and wildlife is amazing. Such flawless service in so unobtrusive a manner is even more noteworthy. This is service and skill of a very high order. Easily among the most memorable and personalized experience anywhere. Kudos Taj, Kudos Team Baghvan !. Nayan, Poonam, Manish, Girish and Gaurav
reviews.title: Perfect jungle getaway

reviews.text: A short trip to Pench with family, still so memorable thanks to the Bhagvan Pench Lodge. Taj Group of hotels, known for their hospitality lived up to the reputation from the time we arrived. Staff super friendly and helpful. The cottages are quaint and very tastefully designed, and have an attached machaan on which you can spend lazy afternoons snoozing amidst the wilderness! Bathrooms are huge with an open shower.
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday

reviews.text: We had a personal butler, so we had everything we wanted without any effort. The safaris arranged we excellent. Unfortunately we didnt spot any tigers that day, but a host of other wild animals.
reviews.title: Will be back

description: Baghvan, on the banks of a nullah (dry river bed) in Pench National Park, offers twelve individual bungalow-inspired suites each with small verandas, indoor and outdoor showers, and a Machan (a covered rooftop watchtower). This enchanting lodge also has a relaxing outdoor sitting area and a pool. One of India’s lesser known parks, Pench is full of ravishing landscapes with lots of open habitats, allowing for excellent wildlife viewing.
